name: B. Verse Pattern
statement:
You are given a text consisting of lines. Each line contains some
space-separated words, consisting of lowercase English letters.We define
a syllable as a string that contains exactly one vowel and any arbitrary
number (possibly none) of consonants. In English alphabet following
letters are considered to be vowels: ”, ”, ”, ”, ” and ”.Each word of
the text that contains at least one vowel can be divided into syllables.
Each character should be a part of exactly one syllable. For example,
the word "" can be divided into syllables as "" and "", "" and "", and
"" and "". Words that consist of only consonants should be ignored.The
verse patterns for the given text is a sequence of integers . Text
matches the given verse pattern if for each from to one can divide words
of the -th line in syllables in such a way that the total number of
syllables is equal to .You are given the text and the verse pattern.
Check, if the given text matches the given verse pattern.
editorial:
Number of syllables, in which we can split a word, can be uniqely
defined by the number of vowels in it.Thus, we need to count the number
of vowels in each line and compare them to the given sequence.
